product_name: Appalachian Trail Guide: Shenandoah National Park - 14th Edition - Guidebook and Maps
long_description: A compact volume to help you plan your thruhike of the Appalachian Trail, the updated edition of. Edited by John Hedrick; maps compiled and published by the Appalachian Trail Conservancy. Softcover; 333 pages; black-and-white photographs and maps. The Potomac Appalachian Trail Club; copyright 2012. Guidebook contains a general descriptions as well as detailed data for the famed footpath; divided by geographical section. Each section includes a brief overview, basic map, shelters and campsites and mile-by-mile descriptions of the trail. Guidebook not only helps you stay oriented, but also describes cultural, historical, and natural highlights of each section so you can get the most out of the hike. Guide divides the Appalachian Trail within the park into 9 sections that correspond to the included maps. Water- and tear-resistant topographic maps include: the North District (A.T. sections 1-2), the Central District (A.T. sections 3-5) and South District (A.T. sections 6-9). Easy-to-read maps of the trail and nearby areas include topographical contours and elevation profiles for the route. Guidebook measures 6.5 x 4.5 x 0.5 in.
short_description: A compact volume to help you plan your thruhike of the Appalachian Trail, the updated edition of Appalachian Trail Guide: Shenandoah National Park includes three water-resistant topo maps.
